title: "The Southern Continent"
body:
So currently we have 3 continent: The northern continent, Valoran, containing the massive Freljord, the vast Noxian Empire as well as the Kingdom of Demacia. Then there's the island continent of Ionia, which is a region in and of itself. Lastly there's "The Southern Continent" or "The Shuriman Continent", consisting mainly of The Shuriman Empire, Icathia and Mount Targon. But does this continent even have a name and what is it? if not then why not? Also how big is this continent in relation to the other continents? And what is with this Kumangra/Mudtown region in the north west of the continent and will this region be explored in the future?(Is this some sort of tropical region as Kumangra is suspiciously close to the old Kumungu jungle)
The southern continent seems mystically empty with mainly just the Shuriman Empire dominating the continent and there could be more to this continent south of the desert for a storytelling/world building perspective.

replies.body:
> [{quoted}](name=Znoxyboy,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=bqaE4aei,comment-id=,timestamp=2017-05-20T21:47:06.952+0000)
>
> ...But does this continent even have a name and what is it? if not then why not? Also how big is this continent in relation to the other continents? And what is with this Kumangra/Mudtown region in the **north west** of the continent and will this region be explored in the future?(Is this some sort of tropical region as Kumangra is suspiciously close to the old Kumungu jungle)...

Unfortunately not the answer you want (not yet), but minor correction - Kumangra and Mudtown are shown to the north east on the Medarda map, not the north west.  Otherwise I have no quibbles with your statements.

I know you know that, and have probably done the thing that I do where I get my east and west mixed up for a brief moment.  I actually still have to use a mnemonic to remind myself; (going clockwise, from top) **N**o-one **E**ats **S**hredded **W**heat.  Which of course isn't true, but that's the mnemonic I learned!

No idea if you can or will answer these but

Which of the 3(?) continents is the largest?

How large is the Freljord? I'm guessing it's not as big as a continent but I can't see it as a large country for some reason.

Will we ever know why Noxus settled on a desert land?

Will the Kumungu Jungle ever be a region like the others? I figured Rengar would be from there but it doesn't look like it.
What makes you think Targon is in the south?

> **Born in the rocky foothills bordering Icathiaâ€™s corrupted shadow**, Taliyah spent her childhood herding goats with her tribe of nomadic weavers. Where most outsiders see Shurima as a beige and barren waste, her family raised her to be a true daughter of the desert and to see beauty in the rich hues of the land. Taliyah was always fascinated by the stone beneath the dunes. When she was a toddler, she collected colorful rocks as her people followed the seasonal waters. As she grew older, the earth itself seemed drawn to her, arcing and twisting to follow her tracks through the sand.

And then...

> **She journeyed west toward the distant peak of Targon**, her natural connection to rock drawing her toward the mountain that brushed the stars. However, **at the northern edge of Shurima, it was those who marched beneath the banner of Noxus** who discovered her power first. In Noxus, magic like hers was celebrated, they told her; revered, even. They promised her a teacher.

The fact that Taliyah had to pass through North Shurima and Noxus to reach Targon is what makes me think Targon is in the northern continent.

Taliyah journeying "west" may be short for "west by north-west".

The Crown of Stone means that Targon is close enough to Demacia to be common knowledge there is a world without global communication.

Nami's story tells us that the Solari territory reaches a coast, even the mountain itself is further inland.

Personally I thought Targon was in the south west of the northern continent, but I suppose it could be in the north-west of the southern continent, in which case Taric's exile must have involved a ship passage, or him passing through Piltover.

I'm not saying you're wrong, I just don't think there is enough information to decisively pin down a location yet.

Pantheon's story also mentions a desert, the most noticeable desert in Runeterra is Shurima. Granted Pantheon is the actual Aspect himself it is unlikely he would travel far from the mountain, only far enough to intercept a troop of mercenaries looking to attack Mount Targon.
Aurelion Sol even flies over Shurima before landing at Mt Targon's foot. Thus Mt Targon is on the same continent as the Shurima empire.

Taliyah did not pass through Noxus, she passed through a Shuriman city that was taken over by Noxus. She was still in Shurima when she was captured. 
Mt Targon is West of Shurima, and more than likely South/ South-west of Demacia across the sea.
Wait she passed through Targon first to reach northern Shurima.
No, the other way around. Except she never made it to Targon.

>"The Southern Continent" or "The Shuriman Continent", consisting mainly of The Shuriman Empire, Icathia and Mount Targon. **But does this continent even have a name and what is it? if not then why not?**

Yes that's such a good question! IMHO the name of the southern continent is League's most perplexing and largely ignored mystery outside of _what is a Darkin?_ etc. This mystery isn't helped by the fact that every time current lore mentions the south, it's only ever referred to as "Shurima" Making it almost impossible to tell if there is a difference between what is the entire land and what is the large area that was **once** the Empire of Shurima. 

If the continent and empire are two different things and the empire has been buried for centuries. Why does lore still refer to the territory of the lost kingdom as such? Let me put it this way, would it not be confusing if Noxus was the name of  Mordekaiser's old kingdom as well?

Oh well time will tell if something will be revealed or not.

Wasn't it confirmed that the northeast of the southern continent is a huge jungle stretching from kumungra to mudtown and down through that big river that you see on the new map? I guess it could be the same jungle referenced in Ezreal's story and maybe where nidalee and zyra live.
